content: this legal document summarizes the progress of a court case in antwerp regarding the division of joint assets it explains that the entry in the share register is considered sufficient evidence of ownership whether the shares were acquired through purchase or gift the term transfer is used to refer to any legal act involving the consideration of shares the evaluation of minority interests and the application of a discount in the valuation process are discussed it is important to exercise caution when dealing with minority stakes as they can still imply significant control rights the influence of policy on shareholding is reflected in the price the text also mentions the applicability of rules in corporate litigation particularly in the area of stock valuation
